flow.descriptionCdata:
e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.17320ec8-07a8-4788-b8a4-87b6f517bee8.prompt=VMWare Host\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.295282c4-f9e2-4687-9419-57ddc9983f35.prompt=Password\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.2b3c7c5d-0de1-40c3-b146-ac4516984708.prompt=VMWare Host\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.2c677dbf-5f70-496f-8f0f-aaf6f0419b33.description=
Creates a new directory at the given path with a random name that starts with a predefined value.

Inputs\:
    nameStarter - The first letters that will compose the new directory name.
    path - Tthe path where to create the new dir.

Results\:
  createdDir - The full path for the newly created directory.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.2e2252ab-5a69-4ad9-9163-8a19c7f4463b.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.3c1b7a32-e222-46bd-b42b-6835d253afbd.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.42ce669c-35d8-497b-8076-a96e70045b20.prompt=VMWare User\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.59ebc255-2ca2-4ef2-b292-0502e3a04a11.prompt=VMWare Host\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.5fa36160-239c-4a5c-b9aa-99bfb05c4ece.prompt=VMWare User\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.6fbae075-dabf-4bd1-bb8f-d07ad0146c4e.prompt=Password\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.8be0302d-b448-41ba-96bf-8b9b1481b212.description=
Exports a Virtual Machine as an Open Virtualization Format (OVF) package in a folder of files format to the local filesystem of the RAS.
The exported package consists of a .ovf descriptor file, .vmdk files for each vm disk and a .mf file that lists the SHA1 hashes for the .ovf and each .vmdk file.

Inputs\:
    host - VMware vCenter, ESX or ESXi host hostname or IP.
    user - VMware username.
    password - VMware user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
Examples\: 443, 80
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    vmDatacenter - Datacenter to get virtual machines from.
    hostSystem - Host system to get virtual machines from.
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.  Required if virtualMachine input is used.
Valid values\: "inventorypath", "name", "ip", "hostname", "uuid", "vmid"
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    path - Local directory path on the RAS to write the ovf template files.  The directory must already exists.
Examples\: "C\:\ovf_templates\exported_vm", "/ovf_templates/exported_vm"
    parallel - If the virtual machine has multiple .vmdk files, should they be downloaded in parallel?  If true, all .vmdk files will be downloaded using separate threads.
        If false, .vmdk files will be downloaded individually.  Depending on the performance characteristics of the network between the host and the RAS and the
        RAS system storage, parallel download may be faster.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
Default value\: "true"
Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.  See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Operation result or reason for failure..
    ovfPath - The path to the .ovf file that was generated on the local filesystem of the RAS.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.93f32a84-24be-45fc-8cc2-55554b6329aa.prompt=VMWare User\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.aafc5a63-8e15-47ea-baf8-9d2a3e08d638.prompt=Password\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.b769786e-a837-41f7-be74-2a9550e23d96.description=
Retrieve power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task completion return message.
powerState - Power state (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.bb26cb0b-924b-4d73-928a-53f2464c4d98.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.ce2ad975-b219-4186-b5cd-84e114d08d4c.prompt=Local path on RAS\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.ced0451b-8d0f-4c61-a234-c6b12c71f8f3.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.d658f001-ff1c-4163-8b4a-912a1e8f8f78.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
async - Asynchronously perform the task (true, false).
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e47f6963-84d2-4e0d-a951-e70d7604e852.description=
Exports a Virtual Machine as an Open Virtualization Format (OVF) package in a folder of files format to the local filesystem of the RAS.
The exported package consists of a .ovf descriptor file, .vmdk files for each vm disk and a .mf file that lists the SHA1 hashes for the .ovf and each .vmdk file.
If the Virtual Machine is in 'poweredOn' state, it will be shut down before the export.
Inputs\:
    host - VMware vCenter, ESX or ESXi host hostname or IP.
    user - VMware username.
    password - VMware user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
Examples\: 443, 80
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.  
Valid values\: "inventorypath", "name", "ip", "hostname", "uuid", "vmid"
    path - Local directory path on the RAS to write the ovf template files.  The directory must already exists.
Examples\: "C\:\ovf_templates\exported_vm", "/ovf_templates/exported_vm"

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.

Returns\:
    createdDir - The location where to find the created files.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
flow.name: Export VM
